column4: I guess my question is:  What is the correct way to auto launch an app when I login to Lubuntu?
lubuntu/lxde uses openbox. and i think it can use the ~/.config/autostart/  directory
I did that.  However, the application I started doesn't close when I log out.  I guess that is the expected behavior.  But I want it so shut down when I log out also...
cant say ive ever noticed the issue.. guess ig can depend on the app.
Should I add a line to my bash_logout file to close it if it's open?
ive never seen an app manage to stay around after i log out of X. :)  unless i spawn it to the background..
I am launching it with the command conky -c /home/<username>/.conky/conkyrc
ive never had conky prevent me from logging out.. what is it doing exactly?
Oh I can log out.  But conky continues to run.  Shows up on the Login screen.
now thats an interesting bug.... never seen that befor.
If I login again conky launches a second time.
check the askubuntu.com site and the forums perhaps...  you could do a 'killall conky'  in your logout file i guess.
Is is because I'm launching it using a .desktop file in HOME/.config/autostart  ?
conky is very popular. id bet if this is a common issue. theres mention of it on the forums, askubuntu.com and the conky forums.
Thanks.  At least I know I didn't so something goofy.
